result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond T Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Offense-Class C/D Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
COUNTS 1 & 2:  Fine is set at ZERO.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be paid by 07-01-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Court orders defendant to pay Milwaukee County District Attorneys Office $722.00 for reimbursement of costs for extradition from Mississippi, to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be paid by 07-01-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

11-18-2016/ Judge Carolina M. Stark  ** ** ** ** ** ** 
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a total of 132 days of sentence credit on counts one and two.  The term of initial confinement on count one is modified to 666 days.  All other orders entered on November 14, 2016 shall remain in effect.** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** **



Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 


Concurrent with: Concurrent with COUNT 2 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 132 days time served.
**11/14/2016  MODIFICATION to maximum term of imprisonment of five (5) years and 674 days.   Initial term of Confinement is 674 days.  Term of Extended Supervision is five (5) years.  Concurrent with count two; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 634 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
Defendant to complete in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with COUNT 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 132 days time served.

SENTENCING AS TO SENTENCE MODIFICATION. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS and 674 DAYS, concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 634 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 674 DAYS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Credit for 634 days time served;
ALL OTHER SENTENCE FACTORS REMAINS THE SAME AS SENTENCED ON 07/01/2015. 

All extended supervision factors ordered on 07/01/2015 remain the same. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Case proceeded to sentencing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Desmond T Burns in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Desmond T Burns in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 132 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS concurrent with COUNT 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 132 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 1 and 2:

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be paid by 07-01-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Engage in fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to complete in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program. 

Court orders defendant to pay Milwaukee County District Attorneys Office $722.00 for reimbursement of costs for extradition from Mississippi, to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be paid by 07-01-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

State placed negotiations on the record. Court informed the parties the due to Branch 17 being in jury trial, sentencing would need to be adjourned. 

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court advised the defendant that any previously filed motions regarding the admissibility of evidence are withdrawn.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 17.

Defendant Desmond T Burns in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Desmond T Burns in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The State filed an Amended Information. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  The charges on the Amended Information remain unchanged from the Original Information.  The amendment is as follows under Count 1: "the maximum term of imprisonment for the underlying crime may be increased by not more than 6 years".  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desmond T Burns in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Desmond T Burns in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court needed to change the next court dates due to rotation.  Parties were advised as of August 3, 2015, case will be assigned to Judge Konkol, branch 44, in room 316 of the safety building.  A substitution was previously done against Judge Konkol, so a new judge will be assigned.  Case is now assigned to Judge Stark, branch 17.  Court contacted Judge Stark's court to receive a new court date.  Defendant is withdrawing his request for a motion hearing, and trial.  Defense is requesting the soonest date for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/16/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Court is removing all other court dates.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Clerk contacted parties to find an agreeable date to change upcoming court dates.  Case is being reassigned to a new Judge in August, due to rotation.  Case adjourned for status on 6/4/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
Reply to government response, for motion to suppress evidence:  Illegal frisk and strip search, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Desmond T Burns not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense will file a revised motion by 5/11/2015.  Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 8/6/2015 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 8/26/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Desmond T Burns not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Court sets bail.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not in court.  A bench warrant was issued on 6/6/2014.  Case is scheduled for a motion hearing.  State is ready to proceed.  Court orders warrant stands.  Remand to Judge.  aw

Defendant Desmond T Burns in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
